meanings.definition: Contrary to religious or moral laws
meanings.sent1: The man's ungodly behavior shocked the entire community.
meanings.sent2: The cult's ungodly rituals were condemned by the local church.
meanings.sent3: It was an ungodly sight to see the cat wearing a tiny hat to church.
meanings.sent4: The ungodly storm raged on, defying all laws of nature.
meanings.sent5: The ungodly act of stealing from the church left a lasting impact on the parishioners.

meanings.sent1: The villain's ungodly deeds terrorized the town.
meanings.sent2: The criminal's ungodly past caught up with him.
meanings.sent3: It was an ungodly twist in the plot when the hero turned out to be the villain.
meanings.sent4: The ungodly darkness of his soul consumed him entirely.
meanings.sent5: The ungodly sins of the past haunted him every night.

meanings.definition: Excessive or unreasonable in amount or degree
meanings.sent1: The ungodly amount of homework left the students exhausted.
meanings.sent2: The ungodly heat made it unbearable to stay outside for long.
meanings.sent3: It was an ungodly challenge to fit all the toys into the tiny box.
meanings.sent4: The ungodly speed at which time passed took everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent5: The ungodly noise from the construction site disrupted the entire neighborhood.
